meanings.definition: Excessive pride in one's own achievements or abilities.
meanings.sent1: Her vainglory in winning the race was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent2: His vainglory knew no bounds after receiving the award.
meanings.sent3: The peacock strutted around the farm with vainglory, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent4: The politician's vainglory blinded him to the needs of his constituents.
meanings.sent5: The king's vainglory led to his downfall as he underestimated his enemies.

meanings.definition: A feeling of excessive pride or self-satisfaction.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't hide her vainglory at being at the top of the class.
meanings.sent2: His vainglory was evident in the way he talked about his accomplishments.
meanings.sent3: The cat displayed vainglory after catching a mouse, strutting around the house triumphantly.
meanings.sent4: The vainglory in her eyes showed that she believed she was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent5: His vainglory was like a bright light that blinded him to his own faults.

meanings.sent1: His vainglory annoyed his friends as he constantly bragged about his possessions.
meanings.sent2: The vainglory in her tone was unmistakable as she talked about her achievements.
meanings.sent3: The peacock's vainglory was comical as it paraded around the zoo, showing off to visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her vainglory was like a mask she wore to hide her insecurities.
meanings.sent5: The vainglory of the actor was so over-the-top that it became a joke among the cast.
